title: Pandas Introduction
subject: Data Science
theory: Pandas is built on NumPy and provides high-level data structures for structured (tabular) data. It allows mixed types (integers, strings, dates) in the same table, unlike NumPy arrays.

examples.explanation: A DataFrame resembles an Excel sheet or SQL table.

real_world_use_cases.description: Loading stock prices with timestamps (index) and values (columns) to calculate moving averages.

summary: Pandas is the de facto standard tool for data manipulation in Python.
